title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: Children on the move are protected from violence, exploitation and abuse and are able to access services and exercise their rights, which contributes to Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

participating-org.narrative: ASSOC VOLUNTARIOS PARA O SERVICO INTERNACIONAL

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children on the move are protected from violence, exploitation and abuse and are able to access services and exercise their rights

description.narrative: The impact of the pandemic and the border’s closure severely affected Venezuelan children and their access to child protection services. UNICEF intensified the work of CP case management teams, identifying and ensuring best interest determination to 1,887 unaccompanied and separated children and 2,357 undocumented children.As socio-economic vulnerabilities aggravated and increased family separation, a cash transfer project has been implemented, benefitting 442 reunited children. Through the “Super Panas”strategy, UNICEF strengthened its support inside and outside shelters, in direct collaboration with the local socio-assistance services (CRAS and CREAS), reaching 17,997 with psychosocial support and response to violence against children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2022
